channel.title: NPR Topics: Games & Humor
channel.description: Games, puzzles, and contests plus odd stories from comedy, art, and society.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2010 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Science Writer Mary Roach Plays Not My Job
item.description: Mary Roach likes to tackle the big and scary topics: like death, in her book Stiff, and sex, in her book Bonk. Her latest, Packing For Mars, is about preparing human beings to travel in space.
item.content:encoded:
Mary Roach likes to tackle the big and scary topics: like death, in her book Stiff, and sex, in her book Bonk. Her latest, Packing For Mars, is about preparing human beings to travel in space.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Rhyming Compound Words
item.description: You are given a compound word and a clue. The answer is another compound word whose halves rhyme, respectively, with the halves of the original compound word. For example, given "lamplight," with the clue "a place to sleep outdoors," the answer would be "campsite."
item.content:encoded:
You are given a compound word and a clue. The answer is another compound word whose halves rhyme, respectively, with the halves of the original compound word. For example, given "lamplight," with the clue "a place to sleep outdoors," the answer would be "campsite."

item.title: Comedian Lisa Lampanelli Plays Not My Job
item.description: Comedy's "Lovable Queen of Mean," is known for being rude professionally, so we've decided to quiz her on how to be polite. She'll answer three questions about etiquette in America.
item.content:encoded:
Comedy's "Lovable Queen of Mean," is known for being rude professionally, so we've decided to quiz her on how to be polite. She'll answer three questions about etiquette in America.

item.title: Three Books For Surviving Graduate School
item.description: The last thing a grad student needs is another reading list, but don't worry -- this one will help. Author Adam Ruben recommends three titles that will help you get through the languorous slog of post-baccalaureate education.
item.content:encoded:
The last thing a grad student needs is another reading list, but don't worry -- this one will help. Author Adam Ruben recommends three titles that will help you get through the languorous slog of post-baccalaureate education.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: This Headline Not Written By Google Scribe
item.description: We play with Google Scribe, Google's new autocomplete service. It finishes whatever you're typing, but it does so with words you'd never type, because it's crazy.
item.content:encoded:
We play with Google Scribe, Google's new autocomplete service. It finishes whatever you're typing, but it does so with words you'd never type, because it's crazy.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Cranky Flight Attendant Can't Have His Job Back
item.description: JetBlue Airways says that there will be no second exits for famed flight attendant Steven Slater -- who captured the nation's imagination with his profanity-laced loudspeaker tirade and jump down a plane's emergency chute, beer in hand.
item.content:encoded:
JetBlue Airways says that there will be no second exits for famed flight attendant Steven Slater -- who captured the nation's imagination with his profanity-laced loudspeaker tirade and jump down a plane's emergency chute, beer in hand.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Jokes To Tell Your Parents For Rosh Hashana
item.description: When Sam Hoffman and Eric Spiegelman's video of Hoffman's 60-something mother telling an off-color joke on YouTube went viral, they knew they had something special. The success of their subsequent website, OldJewsTellingJokes.com, and their upcoming book have proved them right.
item.content:encoded:
When Sam Hoffman and Eric Spiegelman's video of Hoffman's 60-something mother telling an off-color joke on YouTube went viral, they knew they had something special.  The success of their subsequent website, OldJewsTellingJokes.com, and their upcoming book have proved them right.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Hopelessly Devoted To A Challenge
item.description: You are given a five-letter word and a seven-letter word. Rearrange the letters of one of the words to get a synonym of the other word. For example, given "alloy" and "devoted," the answer would be "loyal."
item.content:encoded:
You are given a five-letter word and a seven-letter word. Rearrange the letters of one of the words to get a synonym of the other word. For example, given "alloy" and "devoted," the answer would be "loyal."

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Meghan McCain Plays 'Not My Job'
item.description: John McCain's daughter describes life on the campaign trail in her new book, Dirty, Sexy Politics. We've invited her to play a game called: "For dessert, how about a defibrillator-on-a-stick?" Three questions about State Fair food.
item.content:encoded:
John McCain's daughter describes life on the campaign trail in her new book, Dirty, Sexy Politics. We've invited her to play a game called: "For dessert, how about a defibrillator-on-a-stick?" Three questions about State Fair food.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: English Lives. Tell The Grammar Police.
item.description: Roy Peter Clark of the Poynter Institute says we ought to remind ourselves that language lives, breathes and learns more as it goes along. He advises professionals to write carefully, but not defensively and certainly not drably. Host Scott Simon speaks with Clark about his new book, The Glamour of Grammar: A Guide to the Magic and Mystery of Practical English.
item.content:encoded:
Roy Peter Clark of the Poynter Institute says we ought to remind ourselves that language lives, breathes and learns more as it goes along. He advises professionals to write carefully, but not defensively and certainly not drably. Host Scott Simon speaks with Clark about his new book, The Glamour of Grammar: A Guide to the Magic and Mystery of Practical English.

item.title: Hey, America: What Do You Have In Your Trunk?
item.description: People love to make lists. And when Morning Edition asked our Facebook and Twitter followers to tell us what they keep in the trunk of their cars, the response was huge.
item.content:encoded:
People love to make lists. And when Morning Edition asked our Facebook and Twitter followers to tell us what they keep in the trunk of their cars, the response was huge.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: These Roller Skating Women Get 'Down And Derby'
item.description: Alex Cohen may be a public radio reporter by day, but by night she goes by her roller derby name -- Axles of Evil. Cohen has joined forces with fellow L.A. Derby Doll Jennifer "Kasey Bomber" Barbee to write Down and Derby, an insider's guide to a rough-and-tumble sport.
item.content:encoded:
Alex Cohen may be a public radio reporter by day, but by night she goes by her roller derby name -- Axles of Evil. Cohen has joined forces with fellow L.A. Derby Doll Jennifer "Kasey Bomber" Barbee to write Down and Derby, an insider's guide to a rough-and-tumble sport.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Sandwich Monday: The Denny's Fried Cheese Melt
item.description: For this week's Sandwich Monday, we try the new Denny's Fried Cheese Melt. That's four fried mozzarella sticks stuffed into a grilled cheese sandwich.
item.content:encoded:
For this week's Sandwich Monday, we try the new Denny's Fried Cheese Melt. That's four fried mozzarella sticks stuffed into a grilled cheese sandwich.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Are You Plunking Down Real Money For Virtual Fun?
item.description: If you're hanging out on Facebook, chances are good you're probably playing a game. A new poll says 20 percent of Americans -- 56.8 million people -- have played a game on a social network site in the last three months. When you shell out $30 to get a virtual dog out of a pound that doesn't really exist, who's the real winner?
item.content:encoded:
If you're hanging out on Facebook, chances are good you're probably playing a game. A new poll says 20 percent of Americans -- 56.8 million people -- have played a game on a social network site in the last three months. When you shell out $30 to get a virtual dog out of a pound that doesn't really exist, who's the real winner?

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Things You Didn't Know About I-95
item.description: How many rest stops are there along I-95? How many 24-hour gas stations? What famous politician died just eight days after dedicating the highway? Our handy fact sheet has enough trivia to make you an I-95 nerd.
item.content:encoded:
How many rest stops are there along I-95? How many 24-hour gas stations? What famous politician died just eight days after dedicating the highway? Our handy fact sheet has enough trivia to make you an I-95 nerd.
